meanings.definition: Excessive or extreme sensitivity to stimuli or emotions.
meanings.sent1: She has oversensitivities to loud noises, covering her ears at the slightest sound.
meanings.sent2: His oversensitivities to criticism make it challenging for him to accept feedback.
meanings.sent3: The oversensitivities of the cat to touch led to it wearing a tiny sweater for protection.
meanings.sent4: The oversensitivities of the alarm system ensured that even a whisper would trigger it.
meanings.sent5: The oversensitivities of the flower to sunlight made it wither at the slightest exposure.

meanings.definition: The state of being overly sensitive or easily offended.
meanings.sent1: Her oversensitivities often result in misunderstandings with her friends.
meanings.sent2: The oversensitivities of the child caused them to cry over minor comments.
meanings.sent3: His oversensitivities to jokes made him the target of playful teasing.
meanings.sent4: The oversensitivities of the politician were evident in their reaction to criticism.
meanings.sent5: The oversensitivities of the student made it challenging for the teacher to provide feedback.
